oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Achieving Recognition
Medical Profession
African Americans
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cover of The Knoxville Negro, published by Trent Printing Co. 2104 Magnolia Ave. Knoxville, Tenn. U.S.A., June 1929

This cover of this cream-colored booklet, which has a geometric Art Deco-style border in green and a central scroll medallion in gold, shows Bartow G. Wilson as its author. Wilson was the volume's editor, as indicated by a note at the bottom of the opening essay, by Dr. Henry Morgan Green, on page 4. Other pages of the booklet are available as part of the digital collections of the McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library.
